intro: Calyptranthes belizensis, commonly known as the Belize calyptranthes, is a shrub native to Central America, particularly Belize. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes well-known plants like eucalyptus and clove. The plant is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
